column4: I've got a problem with my audio in ubuntu 8.10. It was working, and now for whatever reason, it is not working. I don't know what might have caused it; I don't think I changed anything (appears to have stopped working upon a reboot). when I try and reload alsa ('alsa reload') I'm told "Loading ALSA sound driver modules: (none to reload)." this is an ibm thinkpad x30 with i830 chipset (ac97 audio, I think)
I've got the same issure, it's "won't fix", revert to 8.04 or wait for the next LTS.
it 'won't fix'? did your problem spontaneously occur recently, or did it happen when you upgraded to 8.10? because I've been running 8.10 since 8.12.
it's spontaneous, I ran 8.10 since RC playing with it, and the bug is listed as "won't fix", meaning it's not going to get fixed upstream. affects all intel i8x0
